intro: Rhaphidospora novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea rhaphidospora, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Rhaphidospora novoguineensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within lowland rainforests.
